tips.text: Chef Fortunato Nicotra delivers Italian entrees that pay homage to founder Lidia Bastianich’s roots. Especially stunning are the sauces laced with exotic ingredients like fennel pollen.
italian wedding is bomb.com
Any spot that plays host to a fight disastrous enough to have Ramona in tears and Jill calling Bobby lamenting “She did it to me again” has to be included.
Italian restaurant with fantastic espresso bar. Cappucino’s are excellent. Best tasting coffee in Midtown East and great gelato in the summer time.
The single greatest source of Italian food in the world. Try not to fill up on the salami and cheese and bread, but they are so good you'll do it anyways. Get the veal Parm on the bone. Buon apetito
Recommended: Vitello tonnato, king crab and sea urchin, mackerel crudo, ravioli, risotto, steak, veal Milanese, sole, sorbetti, gianduja.
Sleepy Italian restaurant hosts an indoor Bocce court in the middle of the restaurant. When making a reservation, reserve one of the red and white checked tables adjacent to the court.
Order the penne a la vodka which is not on the menu, but they will make it every night and it is some of the best in the city.
This place is named for a cast-iron skillet used in Neapolitan cooking. Classics include gnocchi with bufala mozzarella ($14) and salmon carpaccio with arugula and lemon dressing ($10).
One of my abs fav Italian places. Delicious house salad, chicken parm.

venue.name: Sant Ambroeus Coffee Bar at Loews Regency Hotel

tips.text: Great new addition to the neighborhood

venue.name: Obikà Mozzarella Bar - NYC Madison IBM

tips.text: Calling all Mozzarella lovers…come and enjoy a tasting of three handmade mozzarellas, grilled vegetables, olive oil and delicious wine.
Great for a first date, it's inexpensive Italian perfect for two!
One of my favorite places. -Jacqueline Laurita, Real Housewives of NJ

object.text: One of the best Italian spots. Loved the bread

Ask Jose or Olga for a Malibu Pineapple- the absolute perfect concoction for a summer day in the city.
Sponsored Tip: Order San Pellegrino or Acqua Panna water at this UES mainstay and a donation will be made to Share Our Strength! Also: don’t miss the black ink linguini.
Great place to meet up with the girls for drinks. -Luann De Lesseps, Real Housewives of New York City
GREAT PIZZA
The food here is awesome. Try the homeade fazziotelle (like ravioli). Superb
Tucked away in the flagship Armani Store on Fifth Avenue, this chic Italian restaurant is the perfect place to refuel while shopping.
